    • Introduction to simulating data via regression

Introduction to simulating data via regression

Fadhaa Ali

8th December 2024

Intro_to_sim_reg.Rmd
library(RRGG)

Overview

This package is to explain how apllying lm model to data.

Workflow

Steps of fitting lm model to simulated data are given below:

  1. Set the sample size n and the number of independent variables.

  2. Set the parameters of the model βi\beta_i and then generate X.j∼N(n,0,1),wherej=1,2,..,nvX_{.j}\sim N(n,0,1), where j=1,2,..,nv

  3. Calculate yiy_i from yi=βjXij+ϵiy_i=\beta_j X_{ij}+\epsilon_{i}

  4. format the generated data as data frame. Use the following function

library(RRGG)
data(rg_data)
head(rg_data)
#>              Y X0         X1         X2        X3
#> [1,] 13.838638  1  0.6759839 -1.4864561 1.7563931
#> [2,] 14.228633  1  1.2221521  0.2022422 0.1372416
#> [3,] 16.548143  1  1.8062300 -0.6320685 0.3487194
#> [4,] -1.539482  1 -1.2028677 -0.2063560 0.5044400
#> [5,] 11.500072  1 -0.5857792 -0.6562825 2.3337993
#> [6,] 22.294164  1  2.3336178 -0.8468974 1.0543571

Or you can generate the data by this code

new_data<-rgsim(100,3)
head(new_data$data)
#>              Y X0           X1         X2          X3
#> [1,] -2.156245  1 -1.400043517 -0.3872136 -0.42938009
#> [2,]  7.352901  1  0.255317055 -0.7854327  1.36046133
#> [3,] -7.805851  1 -2.437263611 -1.0567369 -0.07085743
#> [4,]  1.441919  1 -0.005571287 -0.7955414 -0.27215368
#> [5,] -1.303546  1  0.621552721 -1.7562754 -2.44668003
#> [6,]  9.317701  1  1.148411606 -0.6905379  0.06548664
head(new_data$par)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    4    4    2    2
  1. Apply regress function to the generated data by
model<-regress(new_data$data)
summary(model)
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = term, data = data.frame(dat))
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -2.10156 -0.62846 -0.09261  0.77994  2.05738 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  4.19538    0.10140   41.37   <2e-16 ***
#> X1           4.13488    0.09654   42.83   <2e-16 ***
#> X2           2.03800    0.10242   19.90   <2e-16 ***
#> X3           1.91935    0.09931   19.33   <2e-16 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 1.003 on 96 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.969,  Adjusted R-squared:  0.968 
#> F-statistic:  1000 on 3 and 96 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16

The output showing the estimated parameters and compared them to the original values
